author: Christopher H. Laco (@claco)
Matt Martz (@sivel)
description: Verifies Rackspace Cloud credentials and returns identity information
notes: The following environment variables can be used, C(RAX_USERNAME), C(RAX_API_KEY), C(RAX_CREDS_FILE), C(RAX_CREDENTIALS), C(RAX_REGION).
C(RAX_CREDENTIALS) and C(RAX_CREDS_FILE) points to a credentials file appropriate for pyrax. See U(https://github.com/rackspace/pyrax/blob/master/docs/getting_started.md#authenticating)
C(RAX_USERNAME) and C(RAX_API_KEY) obviate the use of a credentials file
C(RAX_REGION) defines a Rackspace Public Cloud region (DFW, ORD, LON, ...)

description: The URI of the authentication service.
If not specified will be set to U(https://identity.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2.0/)
File to find the Rackspace credentials in. Ignored if I(api_key) and I(username) are provided.
Environment as configured in I(~/.pyrax.cfg), see U(https://github.com/rackspace/pyrax/blob/master/docs/getting_started.md#pyrax-configuration).
Authentication mechanism to use, such as rackspace or keystone.
Region to create an instance in.
Indicate desired state of the resource
The tenant ID used for authentication.
The tenant name used for authentication.
Whether or not to require SSL validation of API endpoints.

community.general.rax_identity.examples:
- name: Load Rackspace Cloud Identity
  gather_facts: False
  hosts: local
  connection: local
  tasks:
    - name: Load Identity
      local_action:
        module: rax_identity
        credentials: ~/.raxpub
        region: DFW
      register: rackspace_identity
